summary: This is an email from defense attorney Christian Everdell submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to government letters regarding evidence from 'Accuser-3' to Judge Nathan. The letter is submitted under temporary seal for government review of potential redactions.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who submits the response letter to the court regarding Accuser-3 evidence.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (S2 20 Cr. 330).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose legal team is submitting a response regarding evidence from Accuser-3.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Government prosecutor (SANYS) copied on the email regarding the evidence submission.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email.

persons.name: Laura
persons.context: Court staff member copied on the email (last name not provided).

connections.description: Everdell is submitting legal documents on behalf of Maxwell as her defense attorney.
Both are defense attorneys working on Ghislaine Maxwell's case, copied on the same correspondence.
Pagliuca is a government prosecutor in the case against Maxwell.
Everdell is submitting documents to Judge Nathan's chambers.

events.title: Government Letter Regarding Accuser-3 Evidence
events.description: Government submits letter to court regarding evidence related to Accuser-3.

events.title: Follow-up Government Letter
events.description: Government submits follow-up letter regarding Accuser-3 evidence.

events.title: Defense Response Submission
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team prepares response to government letters about Accuser-3 evidence.

events.title: Court Filing Under Temporary Seal
events.description: Defense submits response letter to court under temporary seal for government review of potential redactions.

keyFacts: The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case regarding evidence from 'Accuser-3'.
Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits Maxwell's response to government letters dated November 5 and 7, 2021.
The submission is made under temporary seal to allow the government to propose necessary redactions.
The email reveals established protocol between defense and prosecution for handling sensitive evidence.
Multiple legal professionals are involved including prosecutors, defense attorneys, and court staff.
